alert.note: Alert for Chautauqua; Elk; Greenwood; Montgomery; Wilson (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 09 at 4:01AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Elk, Wilson, Montgomery, Chautauqua and southern Greenwood Counties through 430 AM CDT... At 401 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 13 miles northeast of Latham to near Fredonia. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Coffeyville, Independence, Eureka, Neodesha, Fredonia, Cherryvale, Caney, Sedan, Howard, Cedar Vale, Dearing, Altoona, Moline, Longton, Elk City, Severy, Buffalo, Tyro, Grenola, and Fall River. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
